metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15437 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The Linux kernel before version 5.8 is vulnerable to a NULL pointerdereference indrivers/tty/serial/8250/8250_core.c:serial8250_isa_init_ports() that allowslocal users to cause a denial of service by using the p->serial_in pointerwhich uninitialized.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15437` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-189-generic - 4.4.0-189.219
linux-image-4.4.0-189-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-189.219
linux-image-4.4.0-189-lowlatency - 4.4.0-189.219
linux-image-4.4.0-189-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-189.219
linux-image-4.4.0-189-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-189.219
linux-image-4.4.0-189-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-189.219
linux-image-4.4.0-189-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-189.219
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-189-generic - 4.4.0-189.219
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-189-lowlatency - 4.4.0-189.219
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1079-kvm - 4.4.0-1079.86
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1113-aws - 4.4.0-1113.126
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1080-aws - 4.15.0-1080.84~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1093-azure - 4.15.0-1093.103~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1081-gcp - 4.15.0-1081.92~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1051-oracle - 4.15.0-1051.55~16.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-189.219').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1079.86').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1113.126').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.84~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.103~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1081.92~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1051.55~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1138.147').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1142.151').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
